newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore rubber futures steady to higher at close.
newsitem.headline: Singapore rubber futures steady to higher at close.

text.p: Rubber futures ended steady to slightly higher in moderate trade on some late position adjustments, brokers said on Thursday.

"The market was untraded in the morning session due mainly to an absence of fresh incentives. But prices were steady to higher in the afternoon on some late position adjustments," a local broker said.
They said prices in Tokyo and Kobe were narrowly mixed in range-bound trading but activity was directionless.
At around 0945 GMT, September RSS3 was unchanged from Wednesday's settlement of 127.50 U.S. cents a kg.
January/March RSS1 rose half a cent to 191.00 Singapore cents (US$1.36) a kg.
January/March TSR20 was unchanged from Wednesday's settlement of 181.00 Singapore cents (US$1.29) a kg.
